original: spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor pa'i nyes byas phyir bcos pa ni /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor pa'i nyes byas phyir bcos pa ni /
translated: The way to repair the faults of preparation for a downfall is as follows.üîΩSince the fault of concealing a downfall is a fault that must be confessed, the ceremony for confessing it is as follows.

original: ltung ba de bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas yin pas de mthol ba dang bshags pa'i cho ga ni dge slong gis ltung ba bcab par mi bya ste /
analyzed: ltung ba de bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas yin pas de mthol ba dang bshags pa'i cho ga ni dge slong gis ltung ba bcab par mi bya ste /
translated: A monk should not conceal a downfall.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba'i nyes byas bshags par bya ba gang yang rung ba byung ba na bcab pa'i sems gcig tsam gyis kyang bcab par mi bya bar de nyid kyi mod la /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba'i nyes byas bshags par bya ba gang yang rung ba byung ba na bcab pa'i sems gcig tsam gyis kyang bcab par mi bya bar de nyid kyi mod la /
translated: If he commits any fault of preparation for a downfall that must be confessed, he should not conceal it even for a single moment.

original: mchil lham gnyis phud nas dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa /
analyzed: mchil lham gnyis phud nas dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa /
translated: He should remove his two sandals and confess his fault in the presence of a fully ordained monk who is not a friend.

original: mtshams kyi nang du 'dug pa dang ltung ba ming dang rigs las byung ba mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste /
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang du 'dug pa dang ltung ba ming dang rigs las byung ba mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste /
translated: Sitting in the inner part of the boundary, one should sit in front of a monk who is not a fellow clansman, with whom one has a disagreement about the name and type of a downfall, and bow with palms together.

original: thal mo sbyar ba btud nas ltung ba'i sde tshan gyi ming dang / gang byung ba'i rigs smos te cig car mthol ba dang bshags par byar rung ngo //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba btud nas ltung ba'i sde tshan gyi ming dang / gang byung ba'i rigs smos te cig car mthol ba dang bshags par byar rung ngo //
translated: It is suitable to confess and disclose simultaneously, mentioning the name of the class of downfalls and the type of downfall that has occurred.

original: de'i sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: The mantra for that is:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable, please heed me.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sde tshan las rigs 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sbyor ba che ge mo las byung ba'i nyes byas byung ste /
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba la spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sde tshan las rigs 'di zhes bgyi ba'i sbyor ba che ge mo las byung ba'i nyes byas byung ste /
translated: I, the fully ordained monk named so-and-so, have committed a fault that arises from the application of such-and-such a type of downfalls from the class of downfalls that require confession alone.

original: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa'i mdun du mthol lo //
analyzed: bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi ba ltung ba de tshe dang ldan pa'i mdun du mthol lo //
translated: I, the fully ordained monk named so-and-so, disclose this downfall in the presence of the venerable.

original: mi 'chab bo //
analyzed: mi 'chab bo //
translated: I do not conceal it.

original: 'chags so // mthol zhing bshags na bdag bde ba la reg par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'chags so // mthol zhing bshags na bdag bde ba la reg par 'gyur gyi /
translated: I confess it. If I confess it, I will feel at ease.

original: ma mthol ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum bzlas nyan pas ltung ba mthong ngam zhes smra zhing /
analyzed: ma mthol ma bshags na ni mi 'gyur ro zhes lan gsum bzlas nyan pas ltung ba mthong ngam zhes smra zhing /
translated: The listener says, ‚ÄúDo you see your downfall?‚Äù

original: 'chags pas mthong ngo zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: 'chags pas mthong ngo zhes brjod par bya /
translated: The one confessing says, ‚ÄúI see it.‚Äù

original: nyan pas phyin chad sdom mam zhes smra zhing /
analyzed: nyan pas phyin chad sdom mam zhes smra zhing /
translated: The listener says, ‚ÄúWill you refrain from it in the future?‚Äù

original: 'chags pas sdom mo zhes lan gsum bzlas /
analyzed: 'chags pas sdom mo zhes lan gsum bzlas /
translated: The one confessing says, ‚ÄúI will refrain.‚Äù

original: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la nyan pas thabs yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The listener says, ‚ÄúThis is the method.‚Äù

original: 'chags pas legs so zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'chags pas legs so zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: The one confessing says, ‚ÄúIt is good.‚Äù

original: de tsam gyis na spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba'i nyes byas bshags par bya ba'i ltung ba las ldang ngo //
analyzed: de tsam gyis na spang ba'i ltung byed kyi sbyor ba'i nyes byas bshags par bya ba'i ltung ba las ldang ngo //
translated: By this much, the downfall that is a fault in the process of a downfall that requires confession is cleared away.

original: de'i mod la gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag med na /
analyzed: de'i mod la gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag med na /
translated: If there is no person to whom you can confess and from whom you can receive the ritual for the instant that you have committed the downfall,

original: skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: skya rengs ma shar gyi bar du 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: there is no fault in concealing it until dawn.

original: ji srid du gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du skya rengs shar kyang @194b ma mthol ma bshags pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ji srid du gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed pa de srid du skya rengs shar kyang @194b ma mthol ma bshags pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: As long as one does not find the person to whom one should confess, even if the dawn has come, there is no fault of concealment for the one who has not confessed.

original: gdal mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag med na /
analyzed: gdal mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag med na /
translated: If there is no person to whom one should confess,

original: ji srid du gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed na de srid du mthol zhing bshags pa'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ji srid du gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag ma rnyed na de srid du mthol zhing bshags pa'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: as long as one does not find the person to whom one should confess, there is no fault of concealment for the one who does not have the intention to confess.

original: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang rkyen 'ga' zhig gis bdag nyid der 'gro ba'i skabs med dam /
analyzed: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang rkyen 'ga' zhig gis bdag nyid der 'gro ba'i skabs med dam /
translated: Even if there is a person to whom one should confess, if for some reason one does not have the opportunity to go there,

original: bdag nyid gnas de nas gzhan du song bar gyur na de'i bar du mthol zhing bshags pa'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid gnas de nas gzhan du song bar gyur na de'i bar du mthol zhing bshags pa'i sems med pa la 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: or if one has gone from that place to another, there is no fault of concealment for the one who does not have the intention to confess in the interim.

original: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang ltung ba byung ba de 'di snyam du gal te de'i gan du song la ma brjod na /
analyzed: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag yod du zin kyang ltung ba byung ba de 'di snyam du gal te de'i gan du song la ma brjod na /
translated: Even if there is a person to whom one should confess, if one thinks, ‚ÄúIf I go to him and do not speak,

original: 'chab pa'i nyes par 'gyur du dogs pas de'i dbang gis der mi 'gro 'am /
analyzed: 'chab pa'i nyes par 'gyur du dogs pas de'i dbang gis der mi 'gro 'am /
translated: then I will incur the fault of concealment,‚Äù and because of that one does not go to him,

original: gzhan du song bas brjod pa ma byas pa la yang 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan du song bas brjod pa ma byas pa la yang 'chab pa'i nyes pa med do //
translated: or if one goes to him but does not speak, there is no fault of concealment.

original: rkyen cis kyang ma bskal bar de'i gan du mi 'gro ba dang ; gzhan du 'gro ba dang / skya rengs kyi mdun rol du mi mthol ba dang / 'chab pa'i sems bskyed pa dag ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: rkyen cis kyang ma bskal bar de'i gan du mi 'gro ba dang ; gzhan du 'gro ba dang / skya rengs kyi mdun rol du mi mthol ba dang / 'chab pa'i sems bskyed pa dag ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one does not go to him because one is not prompted by any circumstance, or if one goes to him but does not speak, or if one does not confess before dawn, or if one generates the thought of concealment, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang du 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa med na /
analyzed: gang la mthol zhing bshags par bya ba'i gang zag dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang du 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa med na /
translated: If the person to whom one should confess is a fully ordained monk who is natural, has similar views, is within the same boundary, and has not incurred a similar name and type of downfall,

original: chos 'di pa gcig la je mthol la /
analyzed: chos 'di pa gcig la je mthol la /
translated: one should confess to a single Dharma practitioner.

original: de'i 'og tu dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa'i mdun du bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa'i mdun du bshags par bya'o //
translated: After that, a fully ordained monk who is in his normal state, whose view and name-and-surname are the same, should confess in the presence of a monk whose view and name-and-surname are different, if he is within the same monastic boundary.

original: ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa'i gang zag med na ltung ba rigs las mi mthun pa'i mdun du bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa'i gang zag med na ltung ba rigs las mi mthun pa'i mdun du bshags par bya'o //
translated: If there is no person whose view and name-and-surname are different, he should confess in the presence of a person whose name-and-surname are different.

original: 'dir ming ni ltung ba'i sde tshan no //
analyzed: 'dir ming ni ltung ba'i sde tshan no //
translated: Here, name refers to the class of downfall.

original: rigs ni ltung ba gang byung ba'o //
analyzed: rigs ni ltung ba gang byung ba'o //
translated: Type refers to the downfall that has occurred.

original: chos 'di pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma dang / bslab pa byin pa dang / de slob ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / khyim pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i lta ba can mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa dang /
analyzed: chos 'di pa zhes bya ba ni dge slong ma dang / bslab pa byin pa dang / de slob ma dang / dge tshul dang / dge tshul ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / khyim pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i lta ba can mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa dang /
translated: A person who is a follower of the Dharma is a fully ordained nun, a novice nun, a fully ordained monk, a novice monk, a layman, a laywoman, or a layperson who has the view of the TathƒÅgata and is within the same monastic boundary.

original: lta ba mi mthun pa mtshams gzhan na 'dug pa dag go //
analyzed: lta ba mi mthun pa mtshams gzhan na 'dug pa dag go //
translated: A person who has a different view is within a different monastic boundary.

original: 'dir de dag 'ba' zhig gi rnam par gzhag pa ni mtshan mi mthun pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa la mthol na bcabs par ni mi @195a * //
analyzed: 'dir de dag 'ba' zhig gi rnam par gzhag pa ni mtshan mi mthun pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa la mthol na bcabs par ni mi @195a * //
translated: Here, the presentation of only those is that if one confesses to those who have different characteristics, it is not concealed,

original: 'gyur la nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur la nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
translated: but it is a wrong doing.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dag la mthol na bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dag la mthol na bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la /
translated: If one confesses to those who are not fully ordained, it is not concealed,

original: gnas ngan len rig par byed pa las ni ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len rig par byed pa las ni ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: but it is a downfall due to misusing the rules.

original: gnas ngan len ma yin par rig par byed pa las ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len ma yin par rig par byed pa las ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one confesses to those who are not misusing the rules, it is a wrong doing.

original: chos 'di pa de dag gang yang rung ba mtshams gzhan na 'dug pa dang lta ba mi mthun pa la mthol na bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos 'di pa de dag gang yang rung ba mtshams gzhan na 'dug pa dang lta ba mi mthun pa la mthol na bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
translated: If one confesses to any of those who are Dharma practitioners who are in another region or who have different views, it is not concealed, but it is a wrong doing.

original: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa ma yin pa la mthol na yang bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa ma yin pa la mthol na yang bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
translated: If one confesses to a fully ordained monk who is not abiding in his nature, it is not concealed, but it is a wrong doing.

original: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa la ltung ba ming dang rigs las mthun pa la mthol na yang bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa la ltung ba ming dang rigs las mthun pa la mthol na yang bcabs par ni mi 'gyur la nyes byas su ni 'gyur ro //
translated: If a fully ordained monk who is abiding in his own nature confesses a downfall that is similar in name and type to a fully ordained monk who is abiding in his own nature and whose view and attributes are similar, and who is within the same boundary, he does not conceal the downfall, but he does commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang du 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa la mthol na bcabs par yang mi 'gyur la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang du 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa la mthol na bcabs par yang mi 'gyur la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If a fully ordained monk who is abiding in his own nature confesses a downfall that is similar in name and type to a fully ordained monk who is abiding in his own nature and whose view and attributes are similar, and who is within the same boundary, he does not conceal the downfall, nor does he commit a downfall.

original: 'og ma gzhan dag la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'og ma gzhan dag la yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the other downfalls that follow.

original: ltung ba mthol ba la spyir bstan pa ni mthol ba'i sngags rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba mthol ba la spyir bstan pa ni mthol ba'i sngags rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: The general rule for confessing downfalls is that the formula for confession should be completed.

original: mthol ba'i sngags ril gyis brjod ma nus na tha na ming ngam rigs gcig go bar byas na yang mthol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthol ba'i sngags ril gyis brjod ma nus na tha na ming ngam rigs gcig go bar byas na yang mthol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is unable to recite the entire formula for confession, then if one makes oneself understood by saying the name or the type of downfall, that is also a confession.

original: bshags pa'i sngags ni rdzogs par brjod dgos so //üîΩnyes byas mthol ba la ni ming dang rigs ma brjod par bdag la ltung ba byung ngo zhe'am /
analyzed: bshags pa'i sngags ni rdzogs par brjod dgos so // nyes byas mthol ba la ni ming dang rigs ma brjod par bdag la ltung ba byung ngo zhe'am /
translated: And the mantra of confession should be recited completely.üîΩIn confessing a fault, one should not mention the name or caste, but should confess it by saying, ‚ÄúI have had a downfall,‚Äù

original: bdag gis kha na ma tho ba byas so zhes bya ba rnam pa gang yang rung bas rig par byas na yang rung ngo //
analyzed: bdag gis kha na ma tho ba byas so zhes bya ba rnam pa gang yang rung bas rig par byas na yang rung ngo //
translated: or ‚ÄúI have done something wrong,‚Äù or by some other appropriate means.

original: pham par 'gyur pa'i dngos gzhi ma gtogs pa /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur pa'i dngos gzhi ma gtogs pa /
translated: Except for the actual basis of a defeating offense,

original: sbyor ba dang nyes byas la sogs pa ltung ba gzhan thams cad la yang bcabs pa yod na sngar bcabs pa'i nyes pa phyir bcos par bya zhing phyis ltung ba nyid phyir bcos par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang nyes byas la sogs pa ltung ba gzhan thams cad la yang bcabs pa yod na sngar bcabs pa'i nyes pa phyir bcos par bya zhing phyis ltung ba nyid phyir bcos par shes par bya'o //
translated: in all other cases of downfalls, such as preparatory action and wrong actions, if there is concealment, one should first make amends for the fault of concealment and then make amends for the downfall itself.

original: bcabs pa'i nyes pa phyir bcos pa ni ltung ba ming dang rigs gang byung ba dang / ji srid bcabs pa de dag je mthol bar bya'o //
analyzed: bcabs pa'i nyes pa phyir bcos pa ni ltung ba ming dang rigs gang byung ba dang / ji srid bcabs pa de dag je mthol bar bya'o //
translated: As for making amends for the fault of concealment, one should confess for as long as it took to conceal the downfall, the name and type of downfall that occurred,

original: dge 'dun lhag ma la ni bcabs pa'i nyes pa yod na spo bzhes bya ba'i las kyis de med par bya dgos te /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma la ni bcabs pa'i nyes pa yod na spo bzhes bya ba'i las kyis de med par bya dgos te /
translated: and if there is a fault of concealment in a partial defeat, one should make it disappear by means of the ceremony called ‚Äútransference.‚Äù

original: de ni sngar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni sngar bstan pa yin no //
translated: This has been explained above.

original: mthol ba dang bshags par bya @195b ba'i skabs yod bzhin du mi mthol mi bshags na zhag re re la nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthol ba dang bshags par bya @195b ba'i skabs yod bzhin du mi mthol mi bshags na zhag re re la nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not confess and purify while there is an opportunity to do so, one commits an offense of wrong conduct for each day.

original: gang la mthol ba'i gang zag bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug ba ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa yod na chos 'di pa gzhan la mthol bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang la mthol ba'i gang zag bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug ba ltung ba ming dang rigs las mi mthun pa yod na chos 'di pa gzhan la mthol bar mi bya'o //
translated: If the person to whom one confesses is fully ordained and is in a natural state, has the same view, is of the same gender, and is within the boundaries, but the offense has a different name or type, one should confess to another who is a follower of this teaching.

original: bshags pa ni chos 'di pa gzhan la rnam pa thams cad du mi bya'o //
analyzed: bshags pa ni chos 'di pa gzhan la rnam pa thams cad du mi bya'o //
translated: But one should never confess to another who is not a follower of this teaching.

original: de ltar sbyor ba'i nyes byas mthol zhing bshags na /
analyzed: de ltar sbyor ba'i nyes byas mthol zhing bshags na /
translated: If one confesses the offense of preparation in this way,

original: de'i sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo ni logs shig tu mthol zhing bshags mi dgos so //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba'i sbyor ba'i nyes byas phra mo ni logs shig tu mthol zhing bshags mi dgos so //
translated: one does not need to confess separately the subtle offense of preparation.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngo gzhi phyir bcas pa yang mthol ba dang bshags pa gnyis kyis spong ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi las bslang ba ste /
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngo gzhi phyir bcas pa yang mthol ba dang bshags pa gnyis kyis spong ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi las bslang ba ste /
translated: The basis of a downfall that requires confession is relinquished by both confessing it and promising to abstain from it in the future.

original: de la spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi mthol ba ni dge slong gis kha na ma mtho ba bcab par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de la spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhi mthol ba ni dge slong gis kha na ma mtho ba bcab par mi bya ste /
translated: Confessing the basis of a downfall that requires confession means that a monk should not conceal a downfall.

original: spang ba'i ltung byed sum cu po dag las gang yang rung ba'i dngos gzhi byung ba na /üîΩbcab pa'i sems gcig tsam gyis kyang bcab par mi bya bar de nyid kyi mod la mchil lham gnyis phung nas dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las
analyzed: spang ba'i ltung byed sum cu po dag las gang yang rung ba'i dngos gzhi byung ba na / bcab pa'i sems gcig tsam gyis kyang bcab par mi bya bar de nyid kyi mod la mchil lham gnyis phung nas dge slong bsnyen par rdzogs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa lta ba dang mtshan mthun pa mtshams kyi nang na 'dug pa ltung ba ming dang rigs las
translated: If he commits the actual basis of any of the thirty downfalls that require confession,üîΩhe should not conceal it even for a single moment.üîΩHe should immediately confess it in the presence of a fully ordained monk who is in the same monastic community and who is not impaired in any of the senses, in the manner described in the scriptures.

original: mi mthun pa gcig gi mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste /

original: zhag bcu 'das na 'chang ba'i spang ba sngar bstan pa nyid kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhag bcu 'das na 'chang ba'i spang ba sngar bstan pa nyid kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: If one keeps it for more than ten days, one commits the actual downfall of keeping the extra robe for more than ten days.

original: kha dog la sogs pa las rigs mi mthun pa ni chog pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa las rigs mi mthun pa ni chog pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not suitable to have a robe of a different color, etc.üîΩTherefore, a small robe that is less than one cubit in size is not suitable to be used for more than thirty days.

original: des na gos kyi kha sogs chung ba khru gang yan chad pa ni de'i kha skong @206b ba kha dog sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / de dag gi bye brag las byas pa las rigs mi mthun pa dang / rgyu dag pa la gos dang ras gos la sogs pa dang /
analyzed: des na gos kyi kha sogs chung ba khru gang yan chad pa ni de'i kha skong @206b ba kha dog sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / de dag gi bye brag las byas pa las rigs mi mthun pa dang / rgyu dag pa la gos dang ras gos la sogs pa dang /
translated: If one uses a robe of a different color, such as blue, yellow, or red, or a robe made of a different material, or a pure robe, or a cloth robe, etc.,

original: de dag gi bye brag las byas pa la rigs mi mthun pa gzhan rnyed cing sngar gzhag pa dang / phyis rnyed pa bsdongs nas 'khor gsum khebs pa'i tshad yin du zin kyang de 'khor gsum khebs pa'i tshad du chog pa nyid ma yin pas zhag bcu 'das na 'chang ba'i spang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi bye brag las byas pa la rigs mi mthun pa gzhan rnyed cing sngar gzhag pa dang / phyis rnyed pa bsdongs nas 'khor gsum khebs pa'i tshad yin du zin kyang de 'khor gsum khebs pa'i tshad du chog pa nyid ma yin pas zhag bcu 'das na 'chang ba'i spang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The specific measure of a robe is that it covers the three areas, but if the robe is not sufficient to cover the three areas, then even if one combines the cloth of a different type that one has already laid aside with the cloth one has recently acquired, it is not sufficient to cover the three areas.

original: dkar po nyid ni kha dog thams cad pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: dkar po nyid ni kha dog thams cad pa nyid yin te /
translated: White is the color of all robes.

original: des na kha sogs kyi gos mang ba nyid sngon po la sogs pa gzhag pa la kha skong ba'i gos dkar po ras chen rnyed pa dang / kha sogs kyi gos dkar po gzhag pa la kha skong ba'i gos sngon po la sogs pa rnyed pa ni rigs mi mthun pa ma yin pas de gnyis bsdongs na 'khor gsum khebs pa'i tshad du langs pa ni zhag bcu 'das pa dang 'chang ba'i ltung ba spang
analyzed: des na kha sogs kyi gos mang ba nyid sngon po la sogs pa gzhag pa la kha skong ba'i gos dkar po ras chen rnyed pa dang / kha sogs kyi gos dkar po gzhag pa la kha skong ba'i gos sngon po la sogs pa rnyed pa ni rigs mi mthun pa ma yin pas de gnyis bsdongs na 'khor gsum khebs pa'i tshad du langs pa ni zhag bcu 'das pa dang 'chang ba'i ltung ba spang
translated: Therefore, if one acquires a large piece of white cloth to supplement the blue cloth and so on that one has already laid aside, or if one acquires blue cloth and so on to supplement the white cloth that one has already laid aside, since these are not of a different type, if one combines them and they become sufficient to cover the three areas, then one commits the downfall of keeping the cloth for more than ten days.

original: ba'i dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba'i dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: The actual basis is the actual basis of the first absorption.üîΩ

original: de rnyed na zhag bcu pa de'i dang po la bag la glon pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de rnyed na zhag bcu pa de'i dang po la bag la glon pa nyid yin te /
translated: If one obtains it, it is the first day of the ten days.

original: des na kha sogs kyi gos gzhan pa gang yin pa de dang rigs mthun pa kha skong ba'i gos de rnyed na kha sogs kyi gos gzhag pa dang 'brel pa'i dus kyi zhag bcu pa dang po'am /
analyzed: des na kha sogs kyi gos gzhan pa gang yin pa de dang rigs mthun pa kha skong ba'i gos de rnyed na kha sogs kyi gos gzhag pa dang 'brel pa'i dus kyi zhag bcu pa dang po'am /
translated: If one obtains a substitute garment of a similar type to the original garment, then the first day of the ten days of the original garment is the first day of the ten days of the substitute garment.üîΩOr it is the second or third day of the ten days.

original: gnyis pa'am / gsum pa'am gang dag yin pa'i zhag bcu pa'i skabs de'i dang po de la kha skong ba'i gos phyis rnyed pa de dang / kha sogs kyi gos sngar gzhag pa de nyid so so na 'dug kyang bla ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa'am / gsum pa'am gang dag yin pa'i zhag bcu pa'i skabs de'i dang po de la kha skong ba'i gos phyis rnyed pa de dang / kha sogs kyi gos sngar gzhag pa de nyid so so na 'dug kyang bla ste /
translated: If one obtains the substitute garment after the original garment has been set aside, then the original garment and the substitute garment remain separate.

original: de de'i bag la glon pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de de'i bag la glon pa nyid yin no //
translated: That is its postponement.

original: de yang gal te de'i tshe bag la glon pa nyid yin na 'khor gsum khebs pa'i tshad du chog pa nyid yin na ni de'i tshe zhag bcu pa de nyid la byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang gal te de'i tshe bag la glon pa nyid yin na 'khor gsum khebs pa'i tshad du chog pa nyid yin na ni de'i tshe zhag bcu pa de nyid la byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: If it is postponed at that time, and if the measure of the three cycles is complete, then at that time it should be consecrated.

original: gal te byin gyis ma brlabs na zhag bcu 'das na 'chang ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te byin gyis ma brlabs na zhag bcu 'das na 'chang ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does not consecrate it, then if ten days have passed, he commits the downfall of keeping an extra begging bowl.

original: ji ste de gnyis bsdoms kyang 'khor gsum khebs pa'i tshad du mchog pa nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: ji ste de gnyis bsdoms kyang 'khor gsum khebs pa'i tshad du mchog pa nyid yin na ni /
translated: If the two together exceed the size that covers the three parts of the body,

original: de'i tshe na phyis rnyed pa de yang sngar gzhag pa dang 'dra bar zla ba gcig pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe na phyis rnyed pa de yang sngar gzhag pa dang 'dra bar zla ba gcig pa'i khongs su gtogs pa yin te /
translated: then the later acquisition is included in the one-month period, just like the earlier one.

original: sngar gzhag pa de'i shan gyi dbang gis byi ma de snga ma'i bag la glon pa nyid yin pa'i phyir phyi ma de la yang zla ba gcig pa'i de nyid rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar gzhag pa de'i shan gyi dbang gis byi ma de snga ma'i bag la glon pa nyid yin pa'i phyir phyi ma de la yang zla ba gcig pa'i de nyid rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because the later one is included in the earlier one, the later one should be understood to be included in the one-month period.

original: zla ba gcig pa'i spang ba 'di la zhag bcu pa dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dag ni shan gyi phyir phan tshun ltos pa med do //
analyzed: zla ba gcig pa'i spang ba 'di la zhag bcu pa dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dag ni shan gyi phyir phan tshun ltos pa med do //
translated: In this one-month period, the first, second, and third ten-day periods are not mutually dependent, because they are included in the earlier period.

original: de ltar @207a * //
analyzed: de ltar @207a * //
translated: Thus,

original: yang gzhung las gal te dge slong gis kha sogs kyi gos kyi khru gang gi tshad gcig bzhag nas zhag bcu gcig pa la kha bskang brnyed de chog na ni zhag bcu pa gnyis pa de nyid kyi nang rol du byin gyis brlab par bya ba'am /
analyzed: yang gzhung las gal te dge slong gis kha sogs kyi gos kyi khru gang gi tshad gcig bzhag nas zhag bcu gcig pa la kha bskang brnyed de chog na ni zhag bcu pa gnyis pa de nyid kyi nang rol du byin gyis brlab par bya ba'am /
translated: Moreover, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:

analyzed: gtang bar bya'o // gal te byin gyis rlob par mi byed dam /
translated: If a monk, having set aside a single cubit of cloth for his lower robe, obtains the remainder of the lower robe on the eleventh day, he should either consecrate it or give it away before the end of the second ten-day period.

analyzed: gtong bar mi byed na zhag nyi shu gcig pa la spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If he does not consecrate it or give it away, then on the twenty-first day, he commits a downfall that requires confession alone.

original: dge slong la 'jog pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed du byung na de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: dge slong la 'jog pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed du byung na de ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
translated: If a monk has committed a downfall that requires relinquishment, but has not relinquished it, has not separated from it, and has not confessed it, or

original: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba ma bshags par ram /
translated: has relinquished it, but has not separated from it, and has not confessed it,

original: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par gos zla ba gcig par gtogs pa de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed la de yang snga ma'i shugs gyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: spangs shing bral bar byas la ltung ba ma bshags par gos zla ba gcig par gtogs pa de lta bu gzhan zhig rnyed la de yang snga ma'i shugs gyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one obtains another such as that, it is abandoned by the force of the former.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not commit an offense by that.

original: dge slong gis 'jog pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung la /
analyzed: dge slong gis 'jog pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed byung la /
translated: If a fully ordained monk commits a downfall that is to be refrained from,

analyzed: ji srid du spong ba'i dngos po las ma bshags shing so sor ma bshags par lhung bzed dam /
translated: for as long as he does not confess and individually confess the thing to be refrained from,üîΩif he obtains another alms bowl,

original: chos gos sam /
analyzed: chos gos sam /
translated: another Dharma robe,

original: dra ba'am / phor bu'am /
analyzed: dra ba'am / phor bu'am /
translated: another water strainer,üîΩanother cup,

original: ska rags sam /
analyzed: ska rags sam /
translated: another belt,

original: dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'tsho ba'i yo byad gang yang rung ba gzhan nye bar 'jog na de yang snga ma'i shugs kyis spang bar 'gyur te /
translated: or any other requisite of a renunciate, that is also abandoned by the force of the former.

original: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ltung bar ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not commit an offense by that.

original: dge slong gis dge 'dun mnga' ba'i rdzas gang zag gi bdag nyid du ris su bcad pas zla bas spangs par gtogs pa zhag sum cu gcig pa'i skya rengs las 'das par byas na /
analyzed: dge slong gis dge 'dun mnga' ba'i rdzas gang zag gi bdag nyid du ris su bcad pas zla bas spangs par gtogs pa zhag sum cu gcig pa'i skya rengs las 'das par byas na /
translated: A monk who appropriates for himself a thing belonging to the Sa·πÖgha is expelled for thirty one days.üîΩ

analyzed: 'jog pa'i spang ba'i ltung byed kyi dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: A monk who, by dividing the property of the community into parts, appropriates it for himself, has committed the basic downfall of misappropriation when he has passed the time of the dawn of the thirty-first day.

original: rdzas bzang ngan dang / mang nyung la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: rdzas bzang ngan dang / mang nyung la na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in the quality or quantity of the property.

original: gdong phyis dang chu tshags dang / stan dbyam dang / dre'u rngog la sogs pa yo byad kyi gos byin gyis ma brlabs pa dag la na smad pa med do //
analyzed: gdong phyis dang chu tshags dang / stan dbyam dang / dre'u rngog la sogs pa yo byad kyi gos byin gyis ma brlabs pa dag la na smad pa med do //

analyzed: gos rung ba nyid dang / tshad dang ldan pa dang / tshad las lhag pa la na smad pa med do //

analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po ni gos kha bskang ba la re ba yod pa dang / byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i chos gos gsum med pa'o //

original: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di la yan lag lngas dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The basic downfall is completed by five factors.

original: gos kha bskang ba la re ba yod pa dang / byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i chos gos gsum med pa dang / gos kyi tshad khru gang yan chad dang zhag sum cu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: gos kha bskang ba la re ba yod pa dang / byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i chos gos gsum med pa dang / gos kyi tshad khru gang yan chad dang zhag sum cu 'das pa'o //
translated: There is hope of supplementing the cloth, but there is no consecration of the three robes to be given, and the measure of the cloth is more than one cubit, and it has passed thirty days.

original: de dag la yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
analyzed: de dag la yan lag ma tshang na ci rigs par na smad do //
translated: If those are incomplete, then the offense is a minor one, as appropriate.

original: 'di man chad ni gos ji lta bu dang / tshad ji tsam la @207b byin gyis brlab pa 'chags par 'gyur ba dang / de las bzlog pa la spang bar 'gyur ba spyir bstan pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di man chad ni gos ji lta bu dang / tshad ji tsam la @207b byin gyis brlab pa 'chags par 'gyur ba dang / de las bzlog pa la spang bar 'gyur ba spyir bstan pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: From here on, I will explain in general the kind of cloth, the measure of it, and how consecration is allowed or prohibited in the opposite case.

analyzed: sar pa zhes bya ba ni gang dus tshigs gsum po dag la dus tshigs gcig gis rangs par ma spyad pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNew‚Äù means that it has not been used for one season out of the three seasons.

analyzed: de las snam sbyar byed na snam sbyar de'i rim pa'i tshad kyi mtha' ni nyis rim mo //
translated: If a patched robe is made from that, the measure of the edge of that patched robe is double the width.

analyzed: gding ba'i yang ngo zhes bya ba yang snga ma sar pa las byed na de'i rim pa'i tshad kyi mtha' ni nyis rim mo //

translated: The term ‚Äúsingle‚Äù in ‚Äúsingle the size of the upper robe and the lower robe‚Äù means one layer.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gal te dge slong des bcag pa dang / kha bsgyur ba dang btsam par nus na gos de las snam sbyar dang / gding ba ni nyis rim du bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gal te dge slong des bcag pa dang / kha bsgyur ba dang btsam par nus na gos de las snam sbyar dang / gding ba ni nyis rim du bya'o //
translated: If the monk is able to tear, dye, and sew the cloth, then the sa·πÉghƒÅ·π≠ƒ´ and the mat should be made double the size of the cloth.

analyzed: bla gos dang / mthang gos ni chig rkyang du bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The upper robe and the lower robe should be made single the size of the cloth.üîΩIf the cloth is used for one season, then the sa·πÉghƒÅ·π≠ƒ´ and the mat should be made double the size of the cloth.üîΩThe upper robe and the lower robe should be made single the size of the cloth.

original: dus tshigs su spyad pa las ni nyis 'gyur du bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te gos dus tshigs gcig tu spyad pa las de dag byed na /
analyzed: dus tshigs su spyad pa las ni nyis 'gyur du bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te gos dus tshigs gcig tu spyad pa las de dag byed na /
translated: If the cloth is used for two seasons, then the sa·πÉghƒÅ·π≠ƒ´ and the mat should be made double the size of the cloth.

original: snam sbyar dang gding ba ni bzhi rim du bya'o //
analyzed: snam sbyar dang gding ba ni bzhi rim du bya'o //
translated: The upper robe and the lower robe should be made single the size of the cloth.üîΩIf the cloth is used for three seasons, then the sa·πÉghƒÅ·π≠ƒ´ and the mat should be made double the size of the cloth.üîΩThe upper robe and the lower robe should be made single the size of the cloth.

original: bla gos dang mthang gos ni nyis rim du bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩ'dir gzhung ni dus tshigs su spyad pa'i chos gos ni bgo zas chung ba yin te /
analyzed: bla gos dang mthang gos ni nyis rim du bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'dir gzhung ni dus tshigs su spyad pa'i chos gos ni bgo zas chung ba yin te /

translated: The robe made from scraps of cloth is used as desired.

original: rnying pa nyid dang dengs pa nyid las ni ci dgos pa lhag par sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni phyag dar khrod pa ma yin pa la yang chos gos rang zad de rnying pa dang / sgo skyes kyis bshud pa la sogs pas dangs pa nyid la ni lhan pa ji tsam dgos pa rim pa'am /

translated: What is needed is applied to old and torn robes.üîΩüîΩOne should apply patches to robes that are not refuse rag robes, but are worn out and old, or torn by thorns and so on.üîΩ

original: mtha' sngar bstan pa dag las lhag par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' sngar bstan pa dag las lhag par sbyar bar bya'o //

analyzed: na thams cad nyes byas so //

analyzed: gal te dge slong chos gos las rim pa gzhan gyi byi dor bya ba'i ched du dbog par 'dod pas ji srid du bcag pa la sogs pa'i byi dor byas nas phyis 'di nyid du sbyar ro snyam pa'i rnam pa de lta bu'i sems ma bskyed pa de
